events.title: Dred Scott Decision
events.description: The U.S. Supreme Court delivered its decision in Dred Scott v. Sandford, ruling that African Americans could not be American citizens and that Congress had no authority to prohibit slavery in U.S. territories.
events.significance: This decision intensified national divisions over slavery, contributing to the tensions leading up to the American Civil War.

events.title: The Painkiller Aspirin is Trademarked
events.description: The pharmaceutical company Bayer registered the trademark for Aspirin, marking a significant development in medicine and pain management.
events.significance: Aspirin became one of the most widely used medications worldwide, helping millions with pain relief and cardiovascular conditions.

events.title: Ghana Gains Independence
events.description: Ghana, formerly the British Gold Coast colony, became the first sub-Saharan African country to gain independence from colonial rule.
events.significance: Ghanaâ€™s independence marked a pivotal moment in the decolonization of Africa and inspired independence movements across the continent.

events.title: The Worst Air Disaster in the UK
events.description: The flight of British Airtours Flight 28M caught fire on takeoff at Manchester Airport, resulting in 55 deaths and highlighting issues in airline safety and emergency response protocols.
events.significance: This tragedy led to improved aircraft safety standards and evacuation procedures internationally.
